text: Deborah Miranda is a writer and poet. Her father, Alfred Edward Robles Miranda is from the Esselen and Chumash people, native to the Santa Barbara/Santa Ynez/Monterery, California area. Her mother, Madgel Eleanor (Yeoman) Miranda was of French and Jewish ancestry. ==Biography== Miranda's 2012-2013 sabbatical research was funded by a Lenfest Sabbatical Grant for her project "The Hidden Stories of Isabel Meadows and Other California Indian Lacunae".https://www.wlu.edu/english-department/faculty-and- staff/profile?ID=x216 Miranda is working on a collection of essays titled Hidden Stories of Isabel Meadows and other California Indian Lacunae, and a series of poems in the Voices of each California Mission. She is one of the editors of the two-spirits literature collection Sovereign Erotics. Miranda was awarded a 2015 PEN Oakland/Josephine Miles Literary Award. ==Bibliography== ===Books=== Bad Indians: A Tribal Memoir, Heyday Press, 2012.Bad Indians Publisher's page Sovereign Erotics: An Anthology of Two- Spirit Literature.
